metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9963 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Exim before 4.87.1 might allow remote attackers to obtain the private DKIM signing key via vectors related to log files and bounce messages.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9963` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

exim4 - 4.86.2-2ubuntu2.1
exim4-base - 4.86.2-2ubuntu2.1
exim4-config - 4.86.2-2ubuntu2.1
exim4-daemon-heavy - 4.86.2-2ubuntu2.1
exim4-daemon-light - 4.86.2-2ubuntu2.1
eximon4 - 4.86.2-2ubuntu2.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: exim4 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.86.2-2ubuntu2.1').
